Set up a local development environment with PyTorch and Opacus (or TensorFlow Privacy) to begin experimenting with DP-SGD.

parsed.justification: The response provides three very clear, actionable steps that directly address my goal of contributing to healthcare AI research safely. It respects my beginner status and limited resources by focusing on public datasets and specific, manageable experiments, significantly boosting my confidence to start.

parsed.justification: The response provides specific experiments but underestimates the complexity of MIMIC-III access and DP implementation for beginners, though it does flag important privacy pitfalls and gives concrete technical directions that reduce uncertainty about what privacy-preserving methods exist.

next_steps: Download and explore the MIMIC-III dataset using its official access process to understand its structure and features for mortality prediction.
Install PyTorch and Opacus, then run a simple non-DP vs DP-SGD tutorial on a small subset of MIMIC-III data to test the utility-privacy tradeoff.
Read the Abadi et al. (2016) paper on Deep Learning with Differential Privacy to grasp the basics before attempting the first experiment.
parsed.justification: As a beginner with limited time and compute, this response gives me specific experiments using public datasets I can access quickly, reducing my uncertainty about safe starting points, though full model training might push my resources. It builds my confidence by outlining privacy tools and pitfalls like leakage risks without overwhelming me.
